title.value: Understanding metric-related pitfalls in image analysis validation
title.justification: This is the title of the paper as provided at the beginning of the content.
title.quote: Understanding metric-related pitfalls in image analysis validation

extractions.description: This paper provides insights into the pitfalls related to validation metrics in image analysis, particularly focusing on image-level classification, semantic and instance segmentation, and object detection tasks. The main contribution is a comprehensive collection, visualization, and discussion of these metric-related pitfalls, categorized by a newly created, domain-agnostic taxonomy.

type.justification: The paper is oriented towards the analysis and discussion of theoretical pitfalls rather than empirical results or experiments.
type.quote: The present work provides the first reliable and comprehensive common point of access to information on pitfalls related to validation metrics in image analysis.

name.justification: The paper addresses validation metrics pertinent to image analysis which falls under the domain of Computer Vision.
name.quote: The work serves to enhance global comprehension of a key topic in image analysis validation.

name.justification: The paper specifically mentions biomedical image analysis multiple times, indicating its focus on this area within Computer Vision.
name.quote: While focused on biomedical image analysis, the addressed pitfalls generalize across application domains...

name.justification: The paper discusses segmentation tasks such as semantic and instance segmentation in detail.
name.quote: Metric-related pitfalls...are discussed in the specific context of classification problems, i.e., image analysis problems that can be considered classification tasks at either the image, object, or pixel level. Specifically, these encompass the four problem categories of image-level classification, semantic segmentation, object detection, and instance segmentation.

name.justification: The paper discusses pitfalls related to object detection tasks.
name.quote: A common pitfall lies in the use of metrics for a problem category they are not suited for because they fail to fulfill crucial requirements of that problem category, and hence do not reflect the domain interest (Fig. 1).
